itemDescription: senior officer of the British Indian Army of the Second World War

wikipedia_page.main: Major General Arthur Verney Hammond  (16 October 1892 – 15 January 1982) was a senior officer of the British Indian Army during the Second World War.

response: Following his long military career, Arthur Hammond retired to Camberley in Surrey where he named his residence Sherborne House. He died in April 1919 and is buried in St. Michael's Churchyard, Camberley. He was the father of Arthur Verney Hammond.
* Arthur Verney Hammond (1892–1982), British Indian Army officer
*Arthur Verney Hammond (1892–1982), British Indian Army major general
